Process A→B is isothermal, meaning temperature remains constant, so change in internal energy ΔU is zero.
Since ΔU = 0 for an isothermal process, Q = W according to the first law of thermodynamics.
In the P-V diagram, volume increases and pressure decreases along an isothermal curve from A to B.
Since volume increases, the gas does positive work on its surroundings (W > 0).
From Q = W and W > 0, it follows that Q > 0.
